Module opentdk.api
Package org.opentdk.api.util

Class DateUtil

java.lang.Object
org.opentdk.api.util.DateUtil
public class DateUtil
extends Object
Class with static utility methods to work with date, time and time stamp formats using the java.time package.
Author:
LK Test Solutions

  • Constructor Details

    • DateUtil

      public DateUtil()

  • Method Details

    • setZoneId

      public static void setZoneId​(String zone)
      Set a new time zone by committing a string with the UTC value e.g. 'UTC+01:00'.
      Parameters:
      zone - zoneId

    • compare

      public static int compare​(String dateTime, String compareDateTime)
      Compares to strings as date, time or time stamp.
      Parameters:
      dateTime - first comparison string.
      compareDateTime - second comparison string.
      Returns:
      0 = both instants are equal; -1 = first instant is before second; 1 = first instant is after second.

    • diff

      public static int diff​(String dateTime, String compareDateTime, ChronoUnit type)
      Get the day difference between two instants as integer value. Turn of the year will be taken into account as well. E.g. getDayDiff("20193112", "20200101") would return 1.
      Parameters:
      dateTime - The first comparison input string.
      compareDateTime - The second comparison string.
      type - the unit that will be compared e.g. days or seconds.
      Returns:
      A positive integer value, or 0 if the instants are similar and -1 when no instant format could be detected.

    • get

      public static String get​(String format)
      Retrieves the current date, time or time stamp.
      Parameters:
      format - The preferred date/time format e.g. yyyyMMdd.
      Returns:
      The current instant in the committed format as string.

    • get

      public static String get​(String dateTime, String format)
      Retrieves the date, time or time stamp depending on the input instant.
      Parameters:
      dateTime - A valid date, time or time stamp string in one of the formats defined in EFormat.
      format - The preferred date/time format e.g. yyyyMMdd.
      Returns:
      The formatted/transformed string or an empty string if no instant could be retrieved.

    • get

      public static String get​(long millis, String format)
      Retrieves the current date.
      Parameters:
      millis - The milliseconds from the epoch of 1970-01-01T00:00:00Z.
      format - The preferred date/time format e.g. yyyyMMdd.
      Returns:
      The detected date as string in the default time zone.

    • get

      public static String get​(int diff, String format, ChronoUnit unit)
      Retrieves the current date, time or time stamp shifted to the past or future.
      Parameters:
      diff - The amount to travel. This depends on the committed unit.
      format - The preferred date/time format e.g. yyyyMMdd.
      unit - The travel unit e.g. ChronoUnit.DAYS.
      Returns:
      The resulting date string in the committed format.

    • get

      public static String get​(String dateTime, int diff, String format, ChronoUnit unit)
      Retrieves the committed date, time or time stamp shifted to the past or future.
      Parameters:
      dateTime - A valid date, time or time stamp string in one of the formats defined in EFormat.
      diff - The amount to travel. This depends on the committed unit.
      format - The preferred date/time format e.g. yyyyMMdd.
      unit - The travel unit e.g. ChronoUnit.DAYS.
      Returns:
      The resulting date/time string in the committed format.

    • getFirstOf

      public static String getFirstOf​(ChronoField type, String format)
      Retrieves the first date or time or time stamp depending on the committed type.
      Parameters:
      type - The field to use e.g. ChronoField.DAY_OF_WEEK gets the first day of the week.
      format - The preferred date/time format e.g. yyyyMMdd.
      Returns:
      The resulting date/time string in the committed format.

    • getFirstOf

      public static String getFirstOf​(String dateTime, ChronoField type, String format)
      Retrieves the first date or time or time stamp depending on the committed type.
      Parameters:
      dateTime - A valid date, time or time stamp string in one of the formats defined in EFormat.
      type - The field to use e.g. ChronoField.DAY_OF_WEEK gets the first day of the week.
      format - The preferred date/time format e.g. yyyyMMdd.
      Returns:
      The resulting date/time string in the committed format.

    • getFirstOf

      public static String getFirstOf​(ChronoField type, String format, ChronoUnit unit, int diff)
      Retrieves the first date or time or time stamp depending on the committed type with the possibility to travel to the past or future.
      Parameters:
      type - The field to use e.g. ChronoField.DAY_OF_WEEK gets the first day of the week.
      format - The preferred date/time format e.g. yyyyMMdd.
      unit - The travel unit e.g. ChronoUnit.DAYS.
      diff - The amount to travel. This depends on the committed unit.
      Returns:
      The resulting date/time string in the committed format.

    • getFirstOf

      public static String getFirstOf​(String dateTime, ChronoField type, String format, ChronoUnit unit, int diff)
      Retrieves the first date or time or time stamp depending on the committed type with the possibility to travel to the past or future.
      Parameters:
      dateTime - A valid date, time or time stamp string in one of the formats defined in EFormat.
      type - The field to use e.g. ChronoField.DAY_OF_WEEK gets the first day of the week.
      format - The preferred date/time format e.g. yyyyMMdd.
      unit - The travel unit e.g. ChronoUnit.DAYS.
      diff - The amount to travel. This depends on the committed unit.
      Returns:
      The resulting date/time string in the committed format.

    • getLastOf

      public static String getLastOf​(ChronoField type, String format)
      Retrieves the last date or time or time stamp depending on the committed type.
      Parameters:
      type - The field to use e.g. ChronoField.DAY_OF_WEEK gets the first day of the week.
      format - The preferred date/time format e.g. yyyyMMdd.
      Returns:
      The resulting date/time string in the committed format.

    • getLastOf

      public static String getLastOf​(ChronoField type, String format, ChronoUnit unit, int diff)
      Retrieves the last date or time or time stamp depending on the committed type with the possibility to travel to the past or future.
      Parameters:
      type - The field to use e.g. ChronoField.DAY_OF_WEEK gets the first day of the week.
      format - The preferred date/time format e.g. yyyyMMdd.
      unit - The travel unit e.g. ChronoUnit.DAYS.
      diff - The amount to travel. This depends on the committed unit.
      Returns:
      The resulting date/time string in the committed format.

    • getLastOf

      public static String getLastOf​(String dateTime, ChronoField type, String format, ChronoUnit unit, int diff)
      Retrieves the last date or time or time stamp depending on the committed type with the possibility to travel to the past or future.
      Parameters:
      dateTime - A valid date, time or time stamp string in one of the formats defined in EFormat.
      type - The field to use e.g. ChronoField.DAY_OF_WEEK gets the first day of the week.
      format - The preferred date/time format e.g. yyyyMMdd.
      unit - The travel unit e.g. ChronoUnit.DAYS.
      diff - The amount to travel. This depends on the committed unit.
      Returns:
      The resulting date/time string in the committed format.

    • getNumber

      public static int getNumber​(String dateTime, ChronoField type)
      Retrieves the number of the part of the committed date, time or time stamp depending on the committed type.
      Parameters:
      dateTime - A valid date, time or time stamp string in one of the formats defined in EFormat.
      type - The field to use e.g. ChronoField.DAY_OF_WEEK gets the first day of the week.
      Returns:
      The number as integer value.

    • parse

      public static String parse​(String inStr, String pFormat)
      This method gets a date string out of the committed string (exact match or containment).
      Parameters:
      inStr - The input string that is a date string or contains one.
      pFormat - One of the date formats in EFormat.
      Returns:
      The detected date string or an empty string, if nothing could be found.

    • getLengthMilliseconds

      public static int getLengthMilliseconds()
      Method that gets the current milliseconds, counted from 1st Jan. 1970 and returns the length. The logarithm to the base 10 returns e.g. 3 when the value 1000 is passed, 4 when the value 10000 is passed etc. So one digit has to be added. Another example: The value log10(111) is a bit higher than 2 and the value log10(999) is a bit lower than 3. But the integer cast always returns 2 in this case (round down) and the result of this method is 3, which is correct for both numbers.
      Returns:
      an integer value with the length of the milliseconds.

    • getDateFromAge

      public static String getDateFromAge​(String age, String format)
      Gets the date from a given age. If the age is given as in interval separated with a minus, the function get a random date between the given ages.
      Parameters:
      age - the age to be found as a date. To give an interval of ages, the ages must be separated with a minus within the string.
      format - one of the date formats in EFormat.
      Returns:
      the date of the given age or a random age between the given age interval.

    • getAgeFromDate

      public int getAgeFromDate​(String date)
      Gets an age in years from a given date.
      Parameters:
      date - the date where the age is calculated from in one of the formats defined in EFormat.
      Returns:
      the age in years as integer value.
